channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Weeds effecting the pavement, 24th June
item.description:
You closed off my original request, with its within the councils guidelines but clicking on the link, it doesn’t show what they are for this situation and either way, it’s only going to get worse re the pavements as the weeds get bigger and there are more. Please do not just close this again but instead please give me a call to explain why you are not resolving this request.

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tip of builders rubble adjacent to recycle bins, 24th June
item.description:
Residents at Keston House are experiencing weekly flytipping of builders rubble at this location. It seems that each fly tip is by the same builders, judging from the type of bags, quantity and type of materials dumped, and the flytipping seems to be occurring in the early hours when nobody is around.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kinglake Street, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lime bicycles and scooters occupying resident parking, 24th June
item.description:
Dear Sirs On a daily basis especially since the start of the nice weather bicycles and scooters and electric bicycles parking and. Web thrown on the floor in the majority of the resident parking. At time the allocated area for the bicycles & scooters is not full. This not only out at risk from damage by the bicycles/scooters but also make it impossible or to park. Residents are worry to park there. We have warned the council that it was wrong to convert part of the resident parking to bicycle / scooter bay but unfortunately the council chose to ignore it. Can you please look into moving the bicycle bay to the left of the fix bicycle bay on the left in front of the entrance to Primrose Hill park (today is single yellow line) which will make more sense and will resolve the problem Your earliest consideration will be greatly appreciated Thank you Amir

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 49-50, Prince Albert Road, Chalk Farm, Camden Town, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocking door to link block, 24th June
item.description:
Your council workman put new toilet in but has left old one blocking link block door 12-14 godstow road Se29ba , a blind lady lives in this block when she returns home and goes to use fob key to get in she will fall over it ! Extremely dangerous

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Grovebury Road, Thamesmead, London

item.title: Urgent Maintenance Required – Missed Grass Section, 24th June
item.description:
Hello, I’ve noticed that while the grass has been cut, this particular section has once again been left untouched. As previously mentioned, this area is council property and forms part of my designated fire exit route. Given its importance for safety and accessibility, I kindly request that this section is addressed as a priority and included in the regular maintenance schedule moving forward. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 50-72, Wotton Green, St Mary Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet
